website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a body sunscreen by a popular brand that will fit your budget, this is a good choice.
pros: Affordable yet effective, thanks to the long-wearing formula that doesn't contain oil and offers SPF 50
Spray-on nozzle makes it easy to apply
cons: Some reports of wearers having allergic rashes after using it
Feels a bit sticky on the skin, and doesn't wear well under makeup

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Stuff works, just distribute evenly so you don’t look like a zebra
customer_reviews.author: liz walker

customer_reviews.title: Sunscreen does not work at ALL!!!
customer_reviews.text: This does absolutely nothing. I used it multiple times during the day on my kids faces and they burned so badly I had to keep them out of the sun for 3 days. If you have this, throw it out immediately. And this is the second Neutrogena product for sunscreen hat hasn't work. Don't ever use it, especially on kids.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M Salamone

customer_reviews.title: my son is allergy to this sunscreen
customer_reviews.text: My son is allergy to this sunscreen, also, there is no use for the sun protection. Will not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jush Owen

customer_reviews.title: Nice smelling, easy to apply!
customer_reviews.text: If you don't like using the spray version, this is another great way to apply sunblock (no more greasy, sticky hands!). Also, since this isn't classified as a liquid, you can bring this with you on trips! By the way, this also smells AMAZING! Has a slight coconut smell and goes on clear... perfect for summer. It looks shiny/oily when first applied to skin, but that goes away Lasts a long time (I wasn't able to use it up before my previous stick expired!).
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sunscreen to keep in my purse for easy use while traveling. I applied it liberally on my neck while outside for a few hours on vacation and I got a nasty burn. I don’t sweat much so there wasn’t really a reason to reapply within that time frame.I used this on my daughter and husband the same day and same result, we all burned within a few hours. I haven’t had this problem with other brands and am outdoors frequently for much longer periods of tome. I am throwing this out and not buying any sunscreen from Neutrogena again.
customer_reviews.author: LauraS

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and effective product.
customer_reviews.text: Recently switched to stick vs. spray or lotions. I've really enjoyed the convenience of this product. It applies clear (no rubbing in to remove the white) and it's nearly impossible to get in your eyes. It also travels well in my car at 100+ degree temperatures or -20 degree in the winter (I use this skiing). Overall, the sun protection has been great. It's obvious when I miss a spot, which is always unfortunate, but that would happen with any type of sunscreen.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: When I've been good about applying this
customer_reviews.text: My whole family applies this stuff before we head out into the sun. It's not greasy, but you can tell it's going on. When I've been good about applying this, I've never gotten a burn once, nor has anyone in my family. We keep one in the car, in my purse, and in the house.
customer_reviews.author: myshkamysh

customer_reviews.title: Good for carryon travel
customer_reviews.text: Little challenging to make sure you have full coverage, especially if applying solo. However, useful if you're traveling somewhere sunny without checking bags on the airline! Technically it's a solid, so doesn't use up your precious allotment of liquids on a flight.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Good for (my) sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: For years, any sunscreen I put on my face would cause my face to sting the second I started to sweat. For some reason the sweat on my face reacts negatively to products, it happens with most makeups as well. Anyway, there was no stinging with this sunscreen bar and I've used other bars so it's not just the fact that it was a bar vs. a cream or spray. In the end, no stinging and no sunburn so this gets 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: cristen

customer_reviews.title: No obnoxious smell!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for quite a while, and it's always seemed like it held up well against water and provided good protection. I ran out at one point and tried a couple of other less expensive sprays and the smell was overwhelming--I don't want everyone I run into saying "oh, you were at the beach" because of my smell! Glad to be back to using Neutrogena.
customer_reviews.author: Old EE

customer_reviews.title: brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had been using a stick sunscreen all along. Application is so much easier when trying to deal with a wiggly toddler. I really like the smell, but it's not super strong or overpowering. I love how it doesn't feel oily or greasy. It's so easy to throw in my bag and reapply if needed. Seems to work well, no sunburns so far!!
customer_reviews.author: MommyE

customer_reviews.title: Mild scent
customer_reviews.text: My absolute favorite thing about this is that the scent is not as overwhelming as a lot of the other sunscreens. It's also less greasy than what I've used before, and I like the twist lock option. Worked really well even on skin that was already burnt (because I didn't have sunscreen yet lol). Here's to go a great summer!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L.

customer_reviews.title: lifesaver for wiggleworms and kids with sensory processing disorder
customer_reviews.text: I don't like use aerosol sunscreen on my daughter (tho I fo sometimes) especially on her face, so this is perfect for my little wiggleworm! She doesn't want to sit still and have lotion smeared on her, and she has some mild sensory issues regarding lotions. This is not sticky, goes on clear and dries quickly so this does not aggravate her a bit. Best of all it works! Doesn't run into her eyes abd definitely protects her from the sun. Application is super fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves using the stick to put on her suncreen! It's easy to apply and I have not gotten a sunburn. I like that it is not messy like a spray and we all know how annoying liquid sunscreen is to use. My skin felt moisturized after use too! The only negative about it is user error! I made the mistake of letting my husband get my back and he missed a spot :( Will definitely keep purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Both my boyfriend and I reapplied thoroughly every hour for a couple hours while we were out by the river... both completely burnt and miserable.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly Leigh

customer_reviews.title: If your sweating a lot doesn’t offer protection
customer_reviews.text: If your sweating a lot. This won’t stay. Is nice to apply to your face but if is real hot don’t use. It will not give you the protection you need. It also broke our faces out with zits after couple days of using.
customer_reviews.author: keith estes

customer_reviews.title: Nice for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I used this while on vacation. The temps were extreme and the humidity was high, so I don’t know if this sunblock would have worked better under “normal” conditions. It was easy to carry and easy to apply, but with the humidity I don’t think I got the proper coverage. Overall, I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Pony

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone’s skin
customer_reviews.text: I can see how this is a very appealing sunscreen: good scent, easy to apply, and strong protection. However, I got this sunscreen specifically to protect and bring out the colors of my tattoo sleeve. EVERY TIME I apply this, I break out in this tiny little white pimple like dots which take FOREVER to get rid of. I’ve gone back to using lotions I’ve used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Wonder_Woman

customer_reviews.title: Preferred

I did not get any protection from this product and will end up just throwing it out. It seems like there are a lot of good reviews here and then every now and then a review similar to mine. I should have paid attention to those. The positive reviews seem to be fake. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!  Amazing sunscreen stick for face, lips, shoulders, etc.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE! Took this all over the Caribbean while I was in the pool and at the beach for 9 days. I mainly used this on my face, lips, chest area. It worked perfectly. I only got a tiny sunburn spot by my hairline on my fore-head where I missed a spot. I used this on top of my regular facial sunscreen and spray on body sunscreen to touch up all day long. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

We had minimal sunburn (nothing that wasn’t resolved overnight).
customer_reviews.author: Brittany C

customer_reviews.title: Does the job

customer_reviews.author: Kathy T.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for touch ups

I like to keep the sticks on hand when out with the kids as an easy way to do quick “touch ups”.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Smells yummy!
customer_reviews.text: Goes on well and easily. Seems to do OK with sun protection but takes quite a bit to get coverage. If I were going to use this for my whole body it would last only a few applications. Instead I use it just for my face and small areas.
customer_reviews.author: Meg and her Man

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the stress to a minimum!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works well

customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't sit on or touch painted surfaces after applying!

However, I applied this sunblock to my daughter and then she sat on a painted stool--which had been painted about 8 months ago and used regularly--something happened, maybe a chemical reaction? The paint on the stool transferred onto her legs and edge of skirt. The paint remains gummy and sticky--the only change was this sunblock. Buyer/user beware.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.

He looked like someone had rolled pink paint over his chest! I didn't have any trouble because I blended my application.
customer_reviews.author: bunny16

I don't think I'll ever go back to sunblock lotion -- think about it, I don't have to put this in my "liquids" baggie when I fly and can pack two easily, rather than having to buy way overpriced sunblock when I'm on vacation.

customer_reviews.author: charet

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Sunscreen

customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great application!
customer_reviews.text: I have a toddler who learned very quickly that he did not like the foam or spray on forms of sunscreen! This bar style is very quick to get on - he even likes to help. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica E.

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Nasty, Oily Hands!
customer_reviews.text: Do you hate getting your hands all slimey when you apply sunscreen to your face or one of the little humans that live with you. I do. This little stick makes face applications a breeze, especially if your kids are sporty. I find that after just one soccer game or 30 minutes at the beach, all the forehead and eye areas have lost their protection. This stick makes re-application easy without having to re-oil-up my hands. No excuses for those red under the eyes sunburns!
customer_reviews.author: AML

customer_reviews.title: Great sun stick

customer_reviews.title: Great for use on your face.
